body.p:
Hopkinsville Kentucky
April 10th 1861
Hon J. J. Crittenden & Hon Charles S Morehead
Gentlemen

Permit me to introduce to you Mr Wm H Clark. who Visits your city upon a mission of mercy -- to procure from His Excellency Gov Magoffin a pardon for Jonathan Green who was convicted of manslaughter at the present term of our Court --

Mr Green is a very worthy man who married the daughter of your old friend John Hopson -- I am conversant of all the facts in Mr Greens case and had all his witnesses here present I am Satesfied no conviction would have taken place -- I deem it one of the most Justefiable cases for Executive clemency that has come to my knowledge -- be pleased to give Mr Clark a favourable introduction to the Governor
for any kindness shown by you in this matter will be for ever remembered by your old and faithful friend

I beg to introduce to you Mr Clarke who brought to me the above letter -- He is no doubt a very humane & worthy gentleman, & I hope you will give him a favourable hearing in the case he wishes to submit to your consideration

Hon J J Crittenden or Hon C S Morehead
Frankfort
Kentucky
